DOC.HEAD: Retired New York Times Photographer Dead at 85
DOC.TEXT: Ernest Sisto, an award-winning photographer who spent 49 years with The New York Times, died Friday. He was 85. Sisto, a long-time resident of Long Island, died at 3 a.m. in his home in Rough and Ready, Calif., said his niece, Barbara Castagnetta. Sisto was known particularly for his baseball photos, and he was friendly with New York Yankees stars Joe DiMaggio and Phil Rizzuto. He covered many major sporting events, including the World Series and the Kentucky Derby. Sisto was honored for his work by everybody from the Press Photographers Association to a cigar manufacturer. He relocated to California after his retirement from the Times. He is survived by his wife, Amelia, and two sons, Daniel and Ernest Jr. His niece said Sisto would be cremated, but had no information about services.
